attack.name: Heap Up
attack.text: Search your discard pile for all Energy cards and show them to your opponent. If you find any {M} Special Energy cards there, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. Put all of those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Hard Metal
attack.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Aggron does 40 damage to itself.

pokepower.name: Power Cancel
pokepower.text: Once during your opponent's turn, when your opponent's Pokemon uses any Poke-Power, you may discard 2 cards from your hand and prevent all effects of that Poke-Power. (This counts as the Pokemon using its Poke-Power.) This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Psychic Guard
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Alakazam by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokemon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Tail Influence
attack.text: Your opponent flips a coin until he or she gets heads. For each tails, remove an Energy card attched to the Defending Pokemon and put it on the bottom of your opponent's deck.

attack.name: Charity Tail
attack.text: Before Ambipom does damage, your opponent may discard 2 cards from his or her hand. If he or she does, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 80.

pokebody.name: Downer Material
pokebody.text: If you have Uxie and Mespirit in play, the attack cost of each of your opponent's Basic Pokemon's attack is {C} more. You can't use more than 1 Downer Material Poke-Body each turn

attack.name: Blind Pulse
attack.text: Durin your opponent's next turn, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards from his or her hand to any of his or her Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Kind Egg
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Happiny is anywhere under Blisey, you may choose a number of cards in your hand up to the ammount of Energy attached to Blissey and put those cards in your hand up to the ammount of Energy attached to Blissey and put those cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, draw that many cards. This power can't be used if Blissey is affected by a Special Condition

attack.name: Happy Chance
attack.text: Does 20 damage for each Energy attached to Blissey. Before doing damage, you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Blissey.

pokepower.name: Miracle Oracle
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. Then, discard a card from your hand. If you discard an Energy card, draw 1 more card This power can't be used if Bronzong is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Shady Stamp
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Sprouting
attack.text: Search your deck for a {G} Energy card and attach it to Celebi. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Leaf Tornado
attack.text: You may move any number of basic {G} Energy cards attached to your Pokemon to your other Pokemon in any way you like.

attack.name: Energy Cyclone
attack.text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Breaking Tail
attack.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

pokebody.name: Rainbow Scale
pokebody.text: If an Active Pokemon has Weakness to any of the types of Energy attached to Garchomp, Garchomp's attacks do 40 more damage to that Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Rainbow scale Poke-Body can't be used if Garchomp has any Special Energy cards attached to it.

pokebody.name: Dark Genes
pokebody.text: As long as Honchkrow has the Energy necessary to us its attack, each of your Murkrow can use Honchkrow's attack as its own without the necessary Enery to use that attack.

attack.name: Dark Wing Flaps
attack.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you choose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

pokepower.name: Lure Ring
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lumineon is your Active Pokemon, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that has maximum HP of 100 or more and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokemon. This power can't be used if Lumineon is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Reverse Stream
attack.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each {W} Energy attached to Lumineon. Then, return all {W} Energy attached to Luminon to your hand.

attack.name: Smoke Bomb
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attack.name: Flame Drum
attack.text: If Magby isn't anwhere under Magmortar, discard 2 Energy cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 Energy cards from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

attack.name: Ultra Powder
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. If the first coin is heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. If the second is heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned. If the third coin is heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Fire Counterattack
attack.text: If your opponent has any {R} Pokemon in play, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

pokebody.name: Upper Material
pokebody.text: If you have Uxie and Azelf in play, the Retreat Cost for each Uxie, Mespirit and Azelf (both yours and your opponent's) is 0.

attack.name: Teleportation Burst
attack.text: You may switch Mespirit with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Electromagnetic Induction
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 {L} Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokemon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Explosive Thunger
attack.text: Discard all basic {L} Energy cards attached to Raichu. This attack does 30 damage times the number of {L} Energy cards you discarded

pokepower.name: Firestarter
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a {R} Energy Card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokemon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Evaporating Heat
attack.text: Discard a {W} Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon

attack.name: Payback
attack.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage and discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

attack.name: Ground Burn
attack.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 80 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

pokepower.name: Memory Out
pokepower.text: Once durin your opponent's turn, if Uxie is damaged by an opponent's attack Peven if Uxie is Knocked Out}, you may use this power. The Attacking Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Mind Off
attack.text: If you have Mespirit and Azelf in play, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

pokebody.name: Glaier Snow
pokebody.text: If Abomasnow is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Abomasnow is Knoked Out), the Attacking Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Heavy Blizzard
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benhed Pokemon.

pokebody.name: Sticky
pokebody.text: The Retreat Cost for each player's Pokemon (excluding any Ariados) is {C} more.

attack.name: Offensive Needle
attack.text: Flip a coin, If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Parazlyzed.

pokebody.name: Protective Wall
pokebody.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokemon by your opponent's attacks.

attack.name: Anger Revenge
attack.text: If Bastiodon was damaged by an attack during your opponenet's last turn, this attack does 4 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistane for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Call In
attack.text: Draw a card. If Chingling is anywhere under Chimecho, draw 2 more cards.

attack.name: Strange Bell
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Basic Pokemon, that Pokemon is now Confused.

pokepower.name: Evolutionary Toxic
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you play Crobat from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon. That Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.

attack.name: Strike and Fade
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Flip a coin. If tails, shuffle Crobat and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

attack.name: String Bomb
attack.text: Flip a coin for each Energy from basic Energy cards attached to Exeggutor and to the Defending Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Nutritional Support
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 {G} Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokemon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

pokebody.name: Craggy Face
pokebody.text: As long as Glalie is your Active Pokemon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokemon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Intimidation Pebble
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards or Supporter cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

pokebody.name: Dragon DNA
pokebody.text: Gyrados can use any attack from it's Basic Pokemon. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) If Gyrados uses any attack from its Basic Pokemon, that attack does 30 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Enrage
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. If the first coin is tails, Gyrados is now Confused.

attack.name: Sore Performance
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Concerto
attack.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 damage for each Kricketot and each Kricketune you have in play.

attack.name: Lightning Twister
attack.text: Does 20 damage times the ammount of Energy from basic Energy cards attached to Manectric

attack.name: Chain Lightning
attack.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that is the same type as the Defending Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokebody.name: Jumbo Fin
pokebody.text: If Mantyke is anywhere under Mantine, the Retreat Cost for each of your {W} Pokemon is {C}{C} less.

attack.name: Giant Wave
attack.text: Mantine can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

pokebody.name: Airy Wall
pokebody.text: If your opponent's Pokemon that has 2 or less Energy cards attached to it attacks Mr. Mime, prevent all damage done to Mr. Mime from that attack. If Mime Jr. is anywhere under Mr. Mime, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Mr. Mime.

attack.name: Trick Play
attack.text: Put a coin next to your Active Pokemon without showing your opponent and cover it with your hand. your opponent guesses if the coin is heads or tails. If he or she is wrong, this attack does 50 damage to the Defending Pokemon. If he or she is right, Mr. Mime does 20 damage to itself, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

pokebody.name: Mother Pheromone
pokebody.text: the attack cost of your Nidoran, Nidorina, Nidoran, Nirdorino and Nidoking's attack is {C} less.

attack.name: Give Ais
attack.text: If you have the same number of or less Benched Pokemon than your opponent, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 90.

pokepower.name: Color Shift
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. Ninetales is the same type as the Pokemon (all if that Pokemon is more than 1 type) until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Ninetales is affected by a Special Condition.

attack.name: Fire Blast
attack.text: Discard a {R} Energy attached to Ninetales.

attack.name: Assurance
attack.text: As long as the Defending Pokemon's remaining HP is 60 or less, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

attack.name: Hasty Headbutt
attack.text: Rampardos does 20 damage to itself. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Energetic Impulse
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Slaking is your Active Pokemon, you may flip a coin. If heads, Slaking's Lazy Blow attack's base damage is 130 during this turn. If tails, Slaking can't attack or retreat durin this turn. (If Slaking is no longer your Active Pokemon, this effect ends.)

attack.name: Sidestep
attack.text: If Bonsly is anywhere under Sudowood, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Sudowoodo during your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Persuade
attack.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokeomon. The new Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

pokebody.name: Poison Sacs
pokebody.text: Your opponent can't remove the Special Condition Poisoned by evolving or devolving his or her Poisoned Pokemon. (This also includes putting a Pokemon Level-Up card onto the Poisoned Pokemon.)

attack.name: Knuckle Claws
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned

pokepower.name: ITEM
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before attack), if you have Unown I, Unown T, Unown E, and Unown M on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to you opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 ITEM Poke-Power each turn.

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: Choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon and put it face down. Treat that card as a Special Energy card that provides {C} Energy and doesn't have any effect other than providing Energy. Put that card face up at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attack.name: Bad Temper
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokemon's attacks do 60 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Defensive Claw
attack.text: If Teddiursa is on your Bench, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 damage if Teddiursa on your Bench has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage and remove all damage counters from the Pokemon.

pokepower.name: Freeze-up
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you play Walrein from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may flip 2 coins. If both are heads, discard 1 of the Defending Pokemon and all cards attached to it. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokemon.)

attack.name: Ice Blind
attack.text: If your opponent doesn't discard a card from his or her hand, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Fury
attack.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Whiscash.

attack.name: Magnitude
attack.text: Does 20 damage to each Benched Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's).(Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Evolution Impulse
attack.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Leaf Boomerang
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

pokepower.name: Baby Evolution
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chimecho from your hand onto Chingling (this counts as evolving Chingling) and remove all damage counters from Chingling.

attack.name: Inviting Bell
attack.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Steamroll
attack.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apple Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokepower.name: Evolutionary Vitality
pokepower.text: Once during your turn, when you play Croconaw from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose all Energy cards you find there, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Hover Over
attack.text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

pokebody.name: Cold Fat
pokebody.text: As long as Dewgong is Asleep, any damage done to Dewgong by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attack.name: Collapse
attack.text: Dewgong is now Asleep

attack.name: Fury Attack
attack.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Triple Pick
attack.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Evolved Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Snake Hook
attack.text: Draw a card.

attack.name: Bite and Run
attack.text: Switch Dunsparce with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

attack.name: Gather Up
attack.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attack.name: Marvelous Shine
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 4 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. If tails, remove 4 damge counters from 1 of your Pokemon.

attack.name: Crane Neck
attack.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attack.name: Psybeam
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Pulse Search
attack.text: Look at your opponent's hand.

attack.name: Rock Cannon
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attack.name: Rock Slide
attack.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

pokepower.name: Baby Evolution
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chansey from your hand onto Happiny (this counts as evolving Happiny) and remove all damage counters from Happiny

attack.name: Lively
attack.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokemon

attack.name: Mend
attack.text: Search your discard pile for a {M} Energy card and attach it to Lairon. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from Lairon.

attack.name: Flamethrower
attack.text: Discard an Energy attached to Magmar.

attack.name: Centrifugal Force
attack.text: Does 20 damage times the number of {C} Energy in the Defending Pokemon's Retreat Cost (after aplying effects to the Retreat Cost).

attack.name: Swirling Ripple
attack.text: If your opponent has any {W} Pokemon in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

attack.name: Rescue
attack.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokemon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attack.name: Crash Bomber
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. Then, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

attack.name: Aqua Liner
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched pokemon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Wild Spores
attack.text: If Parasect evolved from Paras during this turn, this attack does 40 damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attack.name: Extended Fungus
attack.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Parasext.

attack.name: Pressurized Gaz
attack.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Rocket Tackle
attack.text: Pupitar does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Pupitar by attacks during your oppenent's next turn.

attack.name: Fireworks
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a {R} Energy attached to Quilava.

attack.name: Spike Armor
attack.text: During you opponent's next turn, if Sandslash is damaged by an damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sanslash is Knocked Out), put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon.

attack.name: Poison Spike
attack.text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, that Pokemon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: Ice Rider
attack.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

attack.name: Hard Face
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Shieldon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance)

attack.name: Shield Attack
attack.text: Flip a coin, If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attack.name: Bonus Leaf
attack.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of our Benched Pokemon that has any {G} Energy attached to it.

attack.name: Whirlwind
attack.text: Your opponenet switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon

pokepower.name: EQUIP
pokepower.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown E is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to Unown E and attach E to 1 of your Pokemon as a Pokemon Tool card. As long as Unown E is attached to a Pokemon, that Pokemon gets +10 HP

attack.name: Hidden Power
attack.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever your opponent flips a coin, treat it as tails.
